title: International Alliance for Lexicography

author: Tanja Wissik, Austrian Academy of Sciences
Iztok Kosem, Trojina – Institute for Applied Slovene Studies

segmentation: Thank you very much in this talk.
We will talk about different aspects of the international lines for lexicography and especially about dissemination and community building.
Because.
And infrastructure will not be sustainable if there is not a community behind this infrastructure.
If there are no people that are using the tools, it's only a bunch of tools and.
Service and so on and so forth, but we really need a community that stands behind the infrastructure so that it can be sustainable.
It's similar to what Toma has said about the teaching aspects.
So we have a lot of effort invested in creating.
The community around the elexis infrastructure and we have like 2 approaches to this community building.
One is this online community engagement to show the people we are.
Here, as an to be infrastructure.
And to inform the community what's going on and on the other hand, it's also important that we have to face to face engagement with the community as the event you are attending now.
So first I will talk about the on line community engagement we have and then I will go on to the different types of face to face engagement we have within the Alexis infrastructure.
So the first engagement you have already seen a lot of times during this event is our elexis website where we publish all our newest Newshour events.
Who is going on?
Travel Alexis, travel ground and so on and so forth.
Then we are engaging with you via social media.
We have the Alexis Twitter account and we have the and Alexis Facebook account where we engage with you and for example during this event we are tweeting live from the event.
But we are also spreading the word about job offers about the travel, grants, new events, things like that on our social media.

The other things that we are now experimenting are also online events, so we have joined the open Data hackathon organized by the Austrian Center for Digital Humanities with the Alexis Hack, so also to engage online with the community, but also with the.
With the goal to support open data.
So because one of the things Alexis want to promote this also open data, and in this tagger turn we provided one.

When we have the next event when Elexis is.
Hiring new staff etc.

We are organizing this event.
So far we had the kickoff meeting in Louisiana in 2018 and now we're at the Alexis Observer event in Vienna and we will have.
At least two more elexis events that are really branded as Elexis event and where we gathered the community around it.
But this wouldn't be enough effort to really create a community around Alexis and so.

Approach that we Co locate or Co organize events as elexis with.

Organized or Co located events.

A publisher has published a new dictionary or something relevant that you don't read in the scientific output.
Or maybe people don't attend the conferences, but you will be able to monitor these news through our website.
And that is it for me.
Thank you very much.
